item.title: Visualizing Fish Encounter Histories
item.description: Encounter histories are the translation of a fishâ€™s path into a row of ones and zeros, each corresponding to a positive or negative detection record at a receiver location in the acoustic array. An encounter history data frame might look like this: A typical pattern of encounter histories for outmigrating juvenile fish is to see the detection rate decline as they migrate downstream and succumb to predation or other mortality
